title: RUT Plateau Noise Robustness Study
description: Systematic parameter sweep to map the noise robustness of CHSH violations in coupled Kuramoto oscillators. Tests K ∈ [0.2, 0.7], Δω ∈ [0.1, 0.5], σ ∈ [0.0, 0.2] to characterize the RUT Plateau regime where violations persist despite noise.

corrected_understanding.initial_hypothesis: Noise breaks perfect lock → enables violations (INCORRECT)
corrected_understanding.correct_mechanism: Antisymmetric coupling generates violations at perfect lock. Noise tests robustness, not creation.
corrected_understanding.key_finding: Violations exist at σ=0 (perfect lock) and persist across σ=0.0-0.2 (RUT Plateau)

sigma_0.0.regime: RUT Plateau - violations at perfect lock!

notes: This experiment CORRECTED the initial hypothesis
Violations exist at σ=0 (perfect lock), contrary to initial expectation
The RUT Plateau shows violations are ROBUST to noise, not created by it
Forgetfulness boundary (PLI<0.85) predicted but not fully mapped (needs σ>0.3)
